doc.title: Meituan (Downgrade to Neutral) / Trip.com (First Take: Beat) / Woolworths (Cutting EBIT outlook) / Shenzhou Int'l (+ve briefing) / Fuji Oil (+ve MTP)
doc.source_uri: 25.9月 普通个人版/9.1 普通个人版/JPM/JPM APAC Consumer Internet Aug 28 -- Meituan downgrade Trip.com beat Woolworths cutting outlook Shenzhou Intl ve briefin_2025-08-27

passages.text: Post a shocking \(97\%\) YoY profit decline from Meituan in 2Q, Alex Yao downgrades the stock to Neutral from OW, now expecting losses for FY25/26 and prolonged pressure on margins/mkt share. We will be hosting a call at 3pm HKT today to discuss the views & outlook - pls ask for details (setting up now!). BABA/JD were down merely \(- 3\% / - 1.6\%\) overnight (Meituan ADR - \(9.7\%\) ). Elsewhere this morning, Trip.com's earnings beat ( \(12\%\) EPS beat vs cons) & looks solid with briefing just started. Given the stock has been largely sideways for the last few months underperforming, would expect the stock to move up today. Yesterday, we had both Anta and Shenzhou reporting in the sportswear sector with question marks around the latter's down move... but briefing confirmed a solid tone & good outlook, and expect recovery in stock price today. Lastly in Australia/Japan - highlighting Woolworths' fourth downgrade to numbers in 12 months, while Fuji Oil is out with solid MTP (briefing after- mkt today). Best, Lisa

- Meituan (3690 HK, DOWNGRADE to Neutral) - Lower barriers, tougher rival and darker outlook (Link)- Trip.com (TCOM US/9961 HK, OW) First Take: Beat / Solid Result (Sales Commentary)- Woolworths Group (WOW AU, Neutral) - Cutting EBIT outlook and P/E multiple below Coles (Link)- Shenzhou International (2313 HK, OW) - Further wallet share gains in 1H, maintain OW (Link)- Fuji Oil (2607 JP, OW) - Solid Mid-term Management Plan, details later today after-mkt (Link)

\* K- Pop, Beauty & Bio Tour in Seoul (Sept 8- 10)  \* Global Beauty Conference in London (Sept 18)  \* Global Luxury & Brands Conference in Paris (Nov 12- 13)  \* Global TMT Conference in HK (Nov 17- 18)
Use the links below to jump straight to each section:
Detailed Highlights  Sector Key Newsflow  Full Research Links  Save the Date: JPM Consumer & Internet EventsCatalyst Calendar (Full Version)  Detailed Highlights

- Deterioration of the LT mkt share outlook & margin structure: Alex Yao downgrades Meituan from OW to Neutral, cuts his 2025/26 adj. EPS from Rmb 5.98 to Rmb -1.1 and Rmb 9.27 to Rmb -0.85 respectively (ie. loss making in FY25/26). His new Jun'PT is HK\\$105 based on 15x '27 P/E. 2Q25 results revealed a higher-than-expected financial impact from escalating competitive intensity in China's food delivery (FD) market, lower entry barrier than previously than initially though and stronger-than expected commitment of a key competitor (ie. Alibaba) in our view. He now expects the financial impact for Meituan to more than double from Rmb 10bn in 2Q to over Rmb 25bn in 3Q25 and deteriorate the margin structure over the long-term for Meituan. The FD competition is now dominated by Alibaba's investment strategy, as it has the most financial resources and strongest commitment to gaining market share. We now expect Alibaba to maintain aggressive investment in FD with only gradual scale back in the next 12 months. See Alex Yao's first take here too

- Feedback (Sales Commentary): The release sent a shock across investors on the magnitude of the profit decline and concerns for read-across into both JD and Alibaba. Overnight ADR dropped \(-3.1\% /1.6\%\) respectively (Meituan -9.7%). It has also given question marks/debates around 1) all of these co's market communication (as results for both JD/Meituan are both significantly worse than previous communication), 2) what is the right multiple for this stock given such profit deterioration & future uncertainty?, 3) how much more is there to sell from Southbound (holds \(\sim 16 - 17\%\) ) and overseas investors (still held among EM funds)?, 4) how big of a downgrade cycle are we going to face from here? See here my "off the call" note

- Alibaba read-through (Sales View): Clearly negative near-term. But when thinking of magnitude, we need to remember Alibaba's much biggest financial base (Expected total Jun Q rev: 248bn vs Meituan's 92bn) + smaller FD business. Alex Yao has estimated adj. EBITA of Rmb 38.3bn for the June Q (which he sees downside risk to after JD and now Meituan) assuming \(\sim 6\)bn spent in QC/FD investment (downside risk) and expect \(\sim 17\)bn in the next Q. In their old segmentation, for this JuneQ we estimate Taobao/Tmall Group (TTG) to represent 45% of revenue and Local Services (which includes ele.me) to be \(\sim 8\%\) . By group EBITA, TTG will be the majority as several other segments make losses (JPMc Cloud to make \(\sim 2.6\)bn EBITA). In other words, the question will be how much their e-commerce biz can make up for their investments and more importantly, how fast Cloud will grow (JPMc Cloud Rev of Rmb 32bn, and EBITA of 2.6bn) and drive future growth (key indicator will be capex: we expect flat q/q \(\sim 25\)bn)? Given cloud as a valuation driver, this could be an offsetting factor. Can they shift the narrative to AI & Cloud?
- Call today @15:00 HKT: We will host a group call with Alex Yao to discuss his downgrade & outlook @15:00 HKT (English) - let me know if you'd like to join!
Table 1: Meituan forecast revisions
Source: J.P. Morgan estimates, Bloomberg Finance L.P. (as of Aug 28, 2025).

- Summary: Both Revenue, adj. NP and EPS all beat cons by \(1\% /14\% /12\%\) . Segment revenue (accommodation, transportation ticketing, packaged tour) all look generally in-line with JPMe, suggesting margin beats. The company separately highlights 1)

online reservations on the int'l OTA platform \(\yen 123,456\) (2) inbound travel bookings surged \(>100\%\) y/y, (3) outbound hotel and air ticket bookings surpassed \(120\%\) on COVID level in the same period in 2019. Stock up \(+1.6\%\) in US after- mkt.
Earnings briefing: From 8:00am HKT / 8:00 EST - register here / results release here

- Cutting numbers further: Bryan cuts his EPS by \(7.2\%\) and \(4.6\%\) in FY26/27 respectively and nudges down his PT by \(5\%\) to A\\$29.60 and remains Neutral. Despite seeing a number of downgrades across the street, Bryan remain below LSD% below consensus. For specifically, we cut FY26 Australia Food EBIT growth outlook from \(+4.1\%\) y/y to \(+2.3\%\) y/y, as Bryan expects Woolworths will find it challenging to meet guidance, given sales underperformance, wage costs system investment, price investment and theft headwinds. We expect Food EBIT margin to contract by -6bps y/y to \(5.3\%\) and stand 26bps below Coles, for the first time in 10 years.

- \(4^{\text{th}}\) downgrade in 12 months: Since the new CEO Amanda Bardell joined in Sept'24 last year, its the fourth downgrade to earnings... We think Woolworths is likely to trade at a discount to the ASX200 broad industrials (22.3x) until the market regains confidence in earnings.

- NOT an indication of Aus Consumer but execution issues: While other results show the consumer to be in good health, WOW is losing share in supermarkets to COL, which Bryan attributes to better execution from COL, an uplift in online sales and lower CFC, WOW prioritising margin over sales, and disruption within the WOW ranks following a number of senior staff departures.

- Briefing highlights (17:30 yday): Shenzhou's 1H25 was a slight beat with sales \(+15\%\) y/y (vs JPMe low teens) and GPM of \(27.1\%\) (in-line) and net profit \(+8\%\) y/y (JPMe MSD%). Other briefing takeaways include: (1) further wallet share gains at core clients with top 4 (Nike, Uniqlo, Adidas, Puma) sales \(+19\%\) , outpacing their respective retail sales; 2) GPM pressure should ease in 2H, given the impact from salary increases was reflected in 2H24; (3) further overseas capacity expansion, including new fabric capacity of 200tons per day in Vietnam and ram up of new garment capacity in Cambodia; (4) limited impact of tariff dynamics witnessed; 5) interim DPS of HK\(1.38 which indicates 60% payout, maintaining a high level.
- Nudging up estimates: Qian nudged up estimates by 1-2% for FY25-27 and rolls forward her target base, with a new PT of HK\(94 (prev\)88) implying 16x 12m Fwd P/E.

- Positive impression: Fuji Oil announced its MTP on Aug 27 after-mkt (briefing scheduled at 15:30 today) and Fujiwara-san comes away positive. The plan targets FY27 Business Profit: Y45bn and ROE of over 10%. Both are slightly below JPME (Y47.4bn, ROE 11% respectively) but is above BBG Cons of Y44.1bn and likely surpassed market expectations.

- Buy thesis: Fujiwara-san expects the combination of growing demand for CBE (Cocoa Butter Equivalent) and compound chocolate and declining impact from cocoa special factors to result in record high business profit in FY25. Our pre-earnings OP estimate is 805bn (+286% y/y) and Y818bn (+19% y/y) in FY25/26 respectively with OPM increasing from 4.7% this year to 5.5% next. Valuation at Y4,000 based on P/E of 13x FY26.

- China Duty-Free Shopping - China will roll out its departure tax refund policy in Jilin Province from Sept. 1, the Ministry of Finance said on Wednesday. The policy will allow overseas tourists to claim back value-added tax on eligible purchases made at designated tax refund stores before leaving the country.- US/China - Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent expects to meet his Chinese counterpart at the end of October or in early November. Bessent also tells Fox Business that each China meeting brings progress.- APR(278470 KS) Ulta Beauty recently began selling 20 different Medicube products through its online and offline channels.

At the same time, Ulta Beauty introduced Medicube with the phrase 'Medicube has arrived' on the central banner of its homepage, encouraging customers to 'explore K- Beauty skincare dedicated to real results.' This prominent display of Medicube implies a positive momentum, given \(30\%\) of APR's sales is in the US.

- K-POP & CHINA: China decides to unilaterally cancel a solo concert by Kepler (pronounced Keppler), which was slated to take place on the 13th of September. No specific reason was given for the cancellation, with no details on if or when the concert plans will resume.- LG H&H(051900 KS): According to investment banking (IB) industry sources on the 27th, LG Household & Health Care is working with Samjung KPMG to sell Haitai HTB. The sale price is expected to be around W250BN. In 2010, LG Household & Health Care acquired a \(100\%\) stake in Haitai Beverage from its largest shareholder, Asahi Beer. Haitai HTB posted sales of W414BN and operating profit of W3.6BN last year, down \(1.3\%\) and \(74\%\) year-on-year, respectively.- SEVEN & I (3382 JP) - To spend \(\sim Y2\) ton over upcoming years on overseas expansion including a new foray into Europe and a debut in South America, Nikkei. While co is still in the midst of deciding the specifics of the scales of the investment, they will "primarily focus investments on North America," CEO/President Dacus told Nikkei.- RYOHIN KEIKAKU (7453 JP) - Chairman Nobuo Domae to step down on Nov. 23.- JT (2914 JP) - CFO Furukawa spoke to Nikkei in an interview that there is room for price increases, primarily overseas, and he forecasts that the overall tobacco market will grow at an average rate of \(3\%\) over the 10 years leading up to 2035.- FUJI OIL (2607 JP) - New MTP targets dividend payout ratio at \(30 - 40\%\) . The plan's core goal is to increase OP to \(\sim Y45\) bn in FY2028, 3.4 times the actual figure for FY2025.

- Anta Sports (2020 HK) - 1H25 in-line; multi-brand portfolio offering growth visibility (Link)- KE Holdings (BEKE US): Company alpha remains intact; share price outperformance requires better China property market sentiment; maintain OW (Link)- Tsingtao Brewery - 1H25 sales/EBITDA up \(2\% /9\%\) and 2H25 margin expansion to accelerate; best risk-reward profile in the China beer space (Link)- Japan Cosmetics Sector - Company growth measures to become more important as domestic demand peaks (Link)- Domino's Pizza Enterprise - FY25 First Take: Negative SSSg and lack of cost-out quantification (Link)- Farm Fresh Berhad (FFB MK) - First Take: 1QFY26 in line; stay OW (Link)- Tabcorp (TAH AU) - Filthy pleasure (Link)
